ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The Sanskrit class has made me become more attentive to the linguistic tenets involved in language. The class has also improved my writing skills in the Devanagari script

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course has been indeed an engaging one where we are constantly made to deal with grammatical analyses through regular homework and practices.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: For someone with a classical language background, learning Sanskrit essentially ties together everything you've ever learned about grammar and conjugations and declensions. It's also a lot easier if you come in with come knowledge of an inflected language.
I would definitely recommend this course as it ensures that one remains consistently in practising the language and internalising its grammatical tenets.
